channel.title: 317 winterLove: Requesting explanation on part of Client.java's run-method

item.title: 317 winterLove: Requesting explanation on part of Client.java's run-method
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Pure_:

Pretty sure the stream class is incorrectly named in every single wL, so you’re just going to get really confused.

iirc the big/little endian was just backwards, other than that it is named correctly

edit: and the word, qword, dword which aren’t really named wrong but they may confuse someone who doesn’t know what type of unit they are whereas short, int and long are much more appropriate names

Read full topic

item.title: 317 winterLove: Requesting explanation on part of Client.java's run-method
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

It’s the first part of the 317 login protocol which reads the name hash and sends the session keys

There are docs available for you to use: https://rswiki.moparisthebest.com/index.php?title=317_Protocol#Login_Protocol_Overview

Edit: I wouldn’t suggest cleaning wL to be your learning curve… if you want experience use something that was written well from the start…

Read full topic

item.title: 317 winterLove: Requesting explanation on part of Client.java's run-method
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

Why are you cleaning a wL source it’s not going to make you a better programmer wL is just full on bad code and your going to develop bad habits. Use a better programmed source like rune-source, Hyperion which are filled with good code and already documented.

Read full topic

item.title: 317 winterLove: Requesting explanation on part of Client.java's run-method
item.dc:creator: @Ole_Kristian Ole Kristian
item.description:
@Ole_Kristian wrote:

Hello!

On my adventure to comment and clean a winterLove-server, there is a part of the run-method in the Client-class that I can’t understand.

Here is the code:

//Anti-nuller by Slysoft.
fillInStream(1);

int namePart = inStream.readUnsignedByte();

//Is being ignored by the client.
for (int i = 0; i < 8; i++)	{
	clientSocketOutputStream.write(0);
}

clientSocketOutputStream.write(0);
outStream.writeQWord(ServerSessionKey);
directFlushOutStream();
fillInStream(2);

Could somebody please take their time to explain what is happening here?
PS: If you’d like the whole run-method, I can copy & paste the whole.

Have a nice day.

Read full topic
item.source: 317 winterLove: Requesting explanation on part of Client.java's run-method
